member.summary:
is used to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) for a Data Lake file system or path
For more information, see
Constructing a Service SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.Version
member.summary: The storage service version to use to authenticate requests made with this shared access signature, and the service version to use when handling requests made with this shared access signature.
member.remarks: This property has been deprecated and we will always use the latest storage SAS version of the Storage service supported. This change does not have any impact on how your application generates or makes use of SAS tokens.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.Protocol
member.summary: The optional signed protocol field specifies the protocol permitted for a request made with the SAS. Possible values are , , and .

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.StartsOn
member.summary: Optionally specify the time at which the shared access signature becomes valid. If omitted when DateTimeOffset.MinValue is used, start time for this call is assumed to be the time when the storage service receives the request.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.ExpiresOn
member.summary: The time at which the shared access signature becomes invalid. This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.Permissions
member.summary:
The permissions associated with the shared access signature. The user is restricted to operations allowed by the permissions. This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy. The ,
or can be used to create the permissions string.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.IPRange
member.summary: Specifies an IP address or a range of IP addresses from which to accept requests. If the IP address from which the request originates does not match the IP address or address range specified on the SAS token, the request is not authenticated. When specifying a range of IP addresses, note that the range is inclusive.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.Identifier
member.summary: An optional unique value up to 64 characters in length that correlates to an access policy specified for the file system.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.FileSystemName
member.summary: The name of the file system being made accessible.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.Path
member.summary: The name of the path being made accessible, or for a file system SAS. Beginning in version 2020-02-10, setting to true means we will accept the Path as a directory for a directory SAS. If not set, this value is assumed to be a File Path for a File Path SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.IsDirectory
member.summary: Beginning in version 2020-02-10, this value defines whether or not the is a directory. If this value is set to true, the Path is a Directory for a Directory SAS. If set to false or default, the Path is a File Path for a File Path SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.Resource
member.summary:
Specifies which resources are accessible via the shared access signature.
Specify "b" if the shared resource is a blob. This grants access to the content and metadata of the blob.
Specify "c" if the shared resource is a blob container. This grants access to the content and metadata of any blob in the container, and to the list of blobs in the container.
Beginning in version 2018-11-09, specify "bs" if the shared resource is a blob snapshot. This grants access to the content and metadata of the specific snapshot, but not the corresponding root blob.
Beginning in version 2020-02-10, specify "d" if the shared resource is a DataLake directory. This grants access to the paths in the directory and to list the paths in the directory. When "d" is specified, the sdd query parameter is also required.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.CacheControl
member.summary: Override the value returned for Cache-Control response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Override the value returned for Content-Disposition response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Override the value returned for Cache-Encoding response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Override the value returned for Cache-Language response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.ContentType
member.summary: Override the value returned for Cache-Type response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.PreauthorizedAgentObjectId
member.summary: Optional. Beginning in version 2020-02-10, this value will be used for the AAD Object ID of a user authorized by the owner of the User Delegation Key to perform the action granted by the SAS. The Azure Storage service will ensure that the owner of the user delegation key has the required permissions before granting access. No additional permission check for the user specified in this value will be performed. This cannot be used in conjuction with . This is only used with generating User Delegation SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.AgentObjectId
member.summary: Optional. Beginning in version 2020-02-10, this value will be used for the AAD Object ID of a user authorized by the owner of the User Delegation Key to perform the action granted by the SAS. The Azure Storage service will ensure that the owner of the user delegation key has the required permissions before granting access. the Azure Storage Service will perform an additional POSIX ACL check to determine if the user is authorized to perform the requested operation. This cannot be used in conjuction with . This is only used with generating User Delegation SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.DataLakeSasBuilder.CorrelationId
member.summary: Optional. Beginning in version 2020-02-10, this value will be used for to correlate the storage audit logs with the audit logs used by the principal generating and distributing SAS. This is only used for User Delegation SAS.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Used for diagnostic scope and exception creation. This is expected to be the instance created during the construction of your main client.
The long-running operation making use of this class. Passing "this" is expected.

The initial value of . Usually, long-running operation objects can be instantiated in two ways:
When calling a client's "Start<OperationName>" method, a service call is made to start the operation, and an instance is returned. In this case, the response received from this service call can be passed here.
When a user instantiates an directly using a public constructor, there's no previous service call. In this case, passing null is expected.
The type name of the long-running operation making use of this class. Used when creating diagnostic scopes. If left null, the type name will be inferred based on the parameter .
The attributes to use during diagnostic scope creation.
The fallback delay strategy when Retry-After header is not present. When it is present, the longer of the two delays will be used. Default is .

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.WaitForCompletionResponseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. The maximum of the retry after value and the fallback is then used as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms", Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.WaitForCompletionResponseAsync(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. The interval between calls is defined by the parameter , but it can change based on information returned from the server. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. In this case, the maximum value between the parameter and the retry-after header is chosen as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms". Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(TimeSpan pollingInterval, CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(pollingInterval, cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: The interval between status requests to the server.
A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Used for diagnostic scope and exception creation. This is expected to be the instance created during the construction of your main client.
The long-running operation making use of this class. Passing "this" is expected.

The initial value of . Usually, long-running operation objects can be instantiated in two ways:
When calling a client's "Start<OperationName>" method, a service call is made to start the operation, and an instance is returned. In this case, the response received from this service call can be passed here.
When a user instantiates an directly using a public constructor, there's no previous service call. In this case, passing null is expected.
The type name of the long-running operation making use of this class. Used when creating diagnostic scopes. If left null, the type name will be inferred based on the parameter .
The attributes to use during diagnostic scope creation.
The fallback delay strategy when Retry-After header is not present. When it is present, the longer of the two delays will be used. Default is .

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternal`1.WaitForCompletionAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. The maximum of the retry after value and the fallback is then used as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms", Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternal`1.WaitForCompletionAsync(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. The interval between calls is defined by the parameter , but it can change based on information returned from the server. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. In this case, the maximum value between the parameter and the retry-after header is chosen as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms". Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(TimeSpan pollingInterval, CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(pollingInterval, cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: The interval between status requests to the server.
A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

remarks.para: This class should be shared via source using Azure.Core.props and contain only common argument validation. It is declared partial so that you can use the same familiar class name but extend it with project-specific validation. Be sure to document exceptions thrown by these methods on your public methods.
